page.title: 07WEASENHAM POND
page.content: The Anglo Saxon word "waes" means water which indicates that Weasenham means "a dwelling near water".There is evidence of underlying water all around and the pond is part of the drainage system for this area.It has been here for 200 hundred years.About 10 years ago the pond was cleared of weed which was placed in the middle to make an island.Last year some farmers built up the island with stones and soil and put wood around it to stop it collapsing into the pond.In hot weather the pond dries out. Mallard and Aylesbury ducks and grey farmyard geese can be seen there and a heron and little grebe have been sighted. Rachel and Helen did a bird count on June 20th 1985. DRAKES DUCKS DUCKLINGS GEESE 15 35 14 4
